result.execSummary:
The defendant Carl D Vogt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Complete anger management.   DNA sample to be taken.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Steven Sarbacker.
Filed by Atty Steven Sarbacker.

Cases heard: 15CM85, 15CM362, 15CM401 & 15CM434, Defendant Carl D Vogt in court with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 1 in 15CM85, count 1 in 15CM362, count 1 in 15CM434. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, 2 years probation in each case. $443 costs in each case, with exception of $453 in 15CM362. Conditions: Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Complete anger management counseling. Submit DNA sample. $1,060 restitution & surcharge for a total of $1,166 in 15CM362. Cash bond(s) applied to restitution. Argument heard from Atty. Sarbacker for expungement possibility. Court denied expungement. Court granted 4 days jail credit in 15CM434. All other counts & 15CM401 read in and dismissed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 8, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Final pre-trial on June 8, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Jury trial on July 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
